label: 落東の旧院
見出し読み: らくとうのきゅういん
説明文: The Shirakawa Northern Cloister (Shirakawa Kitadono 白河北殿) was one of the palaces built by the retired tennō Shirakawa after he had taken priestly vows (1096).  It was a northern palace built to correspond to the Southern Palace in the south. Its presentday location is in Sakyō-ku, Shōgoin-Tōjiryō-machi. (Nihon rekishi chimei taikei Vol. 27: Kyōtoshi no chimei. Tokyo: Heibonsha. 173)
